author: Special Correspondent
text:
Wishing to bring about a change in electoral politics, Ilaignar Koottamaippu, a collective of NGOs in the State plans to field young candidates who have experience in social service in the ensuing Assembly elections.

“The Koottamaippu has representatives from 150 NGOs run by youngsters from across the State. We want to show the people that politics means social service. These youngsters have been serving people in different capacities and whether they win or not will continue to serve the people in their respective constituencies,” said S. Suresh Babu, its founder and coordinator.

Over 40,000 applications from prospective candidates were received by the Ilaignar Koottamaippu from which 2,000 have been shortlisted. In the next few days, 234 candidates would be chosen.

“These youngsters will serve the people, and by 2020, we hope to bring a decisive change in the State,” Mr. Suresh Babu added.

The NGO collective has been visiting colleges and creating voter awareness and the importance of free and fair elections among students.
title: NGO collective to enter poll fray
